# Examples Directory

This directory contains example outputs and reference materials for Jetpack CLI.

## Contents

### ðŸ“š `generated-docs-reference/`
**Real production-quality documentation** generated by Jetpack's Phase 7 documentation system.

This shows developers exactly what documentation will look like when generated for their projects.

#### Structure:
```
generated-docs-reference/
â”œâ”€â”€ getting-started/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ quickstart.md          - 5-minute setup guide
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ prerequisites.md        - System requirements
â”œâ”€â”€ setup/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ dependencies.md         - Package installation
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ configuration.md        - Config file setup
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ environment.md          - Environment variables
â”œâ”€â”€ troubleshooting/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ common-issues.md        - Common problems & solutions
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ verification-failures.md - Fix failed verification checks
â””â”€â”€ verification/
    â”œâ”€â”€ health-checks.md        - Automated validation
    â””â”€â”€ manual-testing.md       - Manual verification steps
```

#### Quality Metrics:
- âœ… **9 markdown files** across 4 sections
- âœ… **Average 161 lines** per file (short & focused)
- âœ… **Max 282 lines** (well under 500-line limit)
- âœ… **100% Stripe-style**: code-first, concise, actionable
- âœ… **Context-aware**: actual config values from installation
- âœ… **Platform-specific**: Windows/macOS/Linux instructions

### ðŸ“„ `sample-manifest.yaml`
Complete `.onboard.yaml` manifest demonstrating Phase 7 documentation features.

Shows how to configure:
- Documentation sections (getting-started, setup, troubleshooting, verification)
- Custom output directory
- Metadata for generated docs
- Integration with all Jetpack features

## Usage for Developers

### 1. Review Generated Documentation
Browse `generated-docs-reference/` to see what documentation looks like:

```bash
# View the quickstart guide
cat examples/generated-docs-reference/getting-started/quickstart.md

# Check troubleshooting docs
cat examples/generated-docs-reference/troubleshooting/common-issues.md
```

### 2. Use Sample Manifest as Template
Copy and customize `sample-manifest.yaml` for your project:

```bash
cp examples/sample-manifest.yaml .onboard.yaml
# Edit .onboard.yaml with your project details
```

### 3. Generate Documentation for Your Project
Run Jetpack to generate documentation:

```bash
jetpack init
# Documentation will be generated in ./docs/
```

### 4. Validate Documentation Quality
Use as reference to ensure your generated docs meet quality standards:
- Short, focused files (< 300 lines recommended)
- Code-first examples
- Clear headings and navigation
- Platform-specific instructions
- Context-aware content

## Regenerating Examples

To regenerate the reference documentation (after code changes):

```bash
# Run integration tests (generates to test-docs-output/)
node tests/integration-docs.test.js

# Or generate manually
node -e "
const generator = require('./src/docs/core/DocumentGenerator');
const parser = require('./src/detectors/manifest-parser');
const manifest = parser.parseManifest('examples/sample-manifest.yaml');
// ... (see tests/integration-docs.test.js for full example)
"
```

## Why This Matters

**For New Developers:**
- See real documentation before generating
- Understand Jetpack's documentation philosophy
- Learn what makes good developer documentation

**For Maintainers:**
- Reference implementation for documentation system
- Validate changes don't break documentation quality
- Showcase Phase 7 capabilities

**For Contributors:**
- Examples to test against when modifying generators
- Verify template engine changes work correctly
- Ensure backwards compatibility

---

> **Note**: Test artifacts (`test-docs-output/`, `.onboard-test.yaml`) are excluded via `.gitignore`.  
> Only production-quality reference documentation is committed to this directory.
